result.execSummary:
The defendant Thaddeus Marczewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
AMENDED 06-23-2016:  Apply 87 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250).  PAID IN FULL.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Diane P. or anyone listed in the Criminal Complaints including Susanna B.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).

Cases 13CM1900, 13CM1923 and 14CF0007 were dismissed and read in.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Count 1.

superMiscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250).  Balance of Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Count 1.

supervisions.notes: Court costs ($343) and DNA surcharge ($200) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision).
Cases 13CM1900, 13CM1923 and 14CF0007 were dismissed and read in.

Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 6/11/14 sentencing. (filed in 14CF362)

Defendant Thaddeus Marczewski in court, in custody, with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.   Bryan C Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Cts. 1, 2 and 4. Court orders credit time to be left open and will be applied to Ct. 1 upon verification.  

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:
Ct. 1:
IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   3 years  Prison (1 year INITIAL CONFINEMENT and 2 years OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON) 
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision - apply any bail
DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision - apply any bail
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s.
No Use or Possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. No contact with Diane P. or anyone else in the Complaints including Susanna B.. DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Ct. 2:
IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   5 years  Prison (2 years INITIAL CONFINEMENT and 3 years OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON) consecutive to Ct. 1
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision - apply any bail
DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision - apply any bail
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s.
No Use or Possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. No contact with Diane P. or anyone else in the Complaints including Susanna B.. DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Ct. 4:
- 90 days jail consecutive to Ct. 1 and Ct. 2
- Court costs of $343.00 (includes DV Surcharge) to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - apply any bail
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - apply any bail
Sentencing hearing on June 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thaddeus Marczewski in court, in custody, with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.   Susan L Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Information filed.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 

  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1, 2, and 4.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1, 2, and 4.  Counts 3 and 5 are dismissed and read in as well as 14CF7, 13CM1900 and 13CM1923.  Bail from all 3 dismissed and read in cases is transferred to this case. 
The court orders a Presentence Investigation in this matter.  
Bail is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
